metadata.feature_description: Configure pagination size for comment lists with options from 5 to 100 items per page.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify dropdown shows all available options

steps.action: Navigated to Community Settings panel in PersonaBar
steps.actual: Community Settings panel opened successfully showing Influence section and Miscellaneous Community Settings

steps.action: Clicked on Comments Page Size dropdown to view options
steps.expected: Dropdown shows all available options: 5, 10, 15, 25, 50, 100 items
steps.actual: Dropdown expanded showing all 6 options: 5 items, 10 items, 15 items, 25 items, 50 items, 100 items

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set comments page size to 5 items

steps.action: Selected '5 items' from Comments Page Size dropdown
steps.actual: Dropdown value successfully changed to '5 items'

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save comments page size and verify save confirmation

steps.action: Clicked Save button after setting Comments Page Size to 5 items
steps.expected: Settings saved successfully with confirmation message
steps.actual: Save completed successfully with 'Item successfully saved.' confirmation message displayed

steps.action: Reloaded the page and navigated back to Community Settings
steps.expected: Comments Page Size should retain the saved value of '5 items'
steps.actual: Comments Page Size reverted to '10 items' instead of the saved '5 items' value

issues: BUG: Comments Page Size setting does not persist after page reload. The save operation shows success message but the value reverts to the previous value (10 items) upon page refresh.

observations: The dropdown UI correctly displays all 6 expected options (5, 10, 15, 25, 50, 100 items)
The save operation appears to complete successfully with a confirmation message, but the value does not actually persist to the database
This appears to be a backend persistence bug in the CmxSettingsController.SaveSettings method or the CmxSettingsController.Instance.SaveCmxSettings implementation
The CommentsPageSize observable in CommunitySettings.js is correctly bound but the saved value is not being retrieved on subsequent page loads
